label: p
sentence: In brief, 80 patients (42 men; mean age 70 years) gave written informed consent and were enrolled in the trial according to the inclusion/exclusion cri- teria (Table 1).

label: p
sentence: A prospective, randomized, single-center, double-blinded and placebo-controlled clinical trial randomly assigned 40 patients to receive pre-and postinterventional therapy with aspirin and clopidogrel.

label: i
sentence: The place- bo group received a 300-mg placebo and 500 mg of aspirin 6 to 12 hours before the intervention as a bolus, with a daily dose of 75 mg of placebo and 500 mg of aspirin for 6 months.

label: i
sentence: The clopidogrel group received 300 mg of clopidogrel (Plavix, Sanofi-Aventis S.A.) and 500 mg of aspirin (Bayer AG, Leverkusen, Germany) 6 to 12 hours before the interven- tion as a bolus, with a daily dose of 75 mg of clopidogrel and 100 mg of aspirin for 6 months following the intervention.

label: i
sentence: A prospective, randomized, single-center, double-blinded and placebo-controlled clinical trial randomly assigned 40 patients to receive pre-and postinterventional therapy with aspirin and clopidogrel.?

label: o
sentence: Endpoints and Extended Follow-up Primary endpoints were the concentration of platelet activation markers using the Chan- dler-Loop vessel model and the rate of 700 CLOPIDOGREL ? ASA VS.

label: o
sentence: The aim of the current secondary analysis was to evalu- ate if the initial benefit seen with 6 months of dual antiplatelet therapy compared to aspirin monotherapy would persist after discontinu- ation of clopidogrel.

label: o
sentence: Secondary endpoints were the clinical development of the patients 6 months after the intervention as reflected by TLR, restenosis, ankle-brachial index (ABI), Rutherford class, serious adverse events (SAE), and days in hospital due to TLR.?
